description: Conversion of existing single family dwellinghouse into six self-contained residential units; and associated works incorporating a two storey rear extension; excavation of a basement with front and rear lightwells and construction of an additional floor.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The external materials to be used in the development shall be as set out in Section 7 of the submitted planning application form and shall match the appearance of those of the existing building as far as possible.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies 7.4 - 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards has been provided in the forecourt of the flats and have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| The parking arrangements for vehicles (including one disabled parking bay) shown on drawing No. 455-P-01-01 G shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site and to ensure that excessive parking is not provided, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| Prior to the first occupation or use of the flats hereby approved, timber fencing 1.8m high shall be installed between the communal amenity area and private amenity areas, and between individual private amenity areas as marked out on approved plan 455-P-01-01 H. This fencing shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the privacy and living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with Policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); Policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and the National Planning Policy Framework.
| The ground floor windows in the southern elevation shall permanently contain only obscure glass up to 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.
Reason: To protect the privacy and living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Ealing's Adopted DPD (2013) policies 7A and 7B.

| Provision for at least 9 cycle spaces in the cycle storage area shown on approved plan reference 455-P-01-01 D shall be implemented in accordance with adopted standards and shall be provided prior to occupation of the units and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely living room/kitchen/bathroom above/adjoining bedroom of separate dwelling and bedroom adjacent to communal main entrance and stairs. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall ensure that the noise standards specified in BS8233:2014 will be met for internal rooms and external amenity areas and acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building). Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| No operations shall commence on site in connection with the development hereby approved until a scheme for the protection of existing trees that are not proposed for removal has been submitted to and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include the following:

o     	Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
o           A plan detailing all trees, shrubs, hedges planned for retention and removal.
o           Soil assessments/survey
o           Timing and phasing of works
o           Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o           Site specific construction specifications
o           Access arrangements and car parking
o           Level changes
o           Landscaping proposals

o       	A Tree protection plan in accordance with BS5837 detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
o           Soil remediation plans.

All tree protection methods approved shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To secure the protection during the demolition and construction phase of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016), policy 5.10 the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Ealing's SPD9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.
| Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved acoustic glass shall be installed in the basement and ground floor windows of the front elevation.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | All boilers to serve the energy requirements of the development, including space heating and hot water to the flats, shall use Ultra-low NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh and be compliant with the NOx (g/mÂ²) benchmarks as set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. Such boilers shall be installed prior to first occupation of the development and thereafter shall be permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).
